comment: The only grades for the semester are the 5 tests you take including the final. I would recommend showing up to class, but if you don't you're defiantly gonna want to read or else you will not do good whatsoever on the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Vejnar's history class is FULL of lectures, so be sure to take good notes. If you are even the slightest bit interested in history, and you can spit out a few rambling essays, then you will EASILY pass. Vejnar's curriculum and approach to history are both modern and interesting. I highly suggest his class.

Amazing professor!! Very straight to the point course if you dont come for notes you wont pass although everything will be online as far as notes go. The class is based off of 5 test that make your grade. I genuinely enjoyed his class and he is an amazing professor with great understanding and explanation along with some good stories.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very knowledgable about what he teaches, but tests were fairly difficult
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I didn't enjoy the format of the class. You have 3 essays and 3 essay exams. He doesn't require you to cite but expect the essays to be 650 -750 words and the exams 1 1/2 pages with an hour to take the exam. Though the last exam, he gave us 3 hours. I didn't understand what he wanted out of the essays and didn't enjoy the time limit on tests.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Loved his class! He really enjoys what he teaches over and makes class enjoyable. We are graded on 3 reflection essays and 3 test which are essays. You have an hour to do the essay test. He does state that your grammar matters for the essays you turn in. He answers his emails quickly. If you turn a paper in late, he docks 10 points.

This class does not have many assignments. There are reflection essays and test essays that make up your grade. 600 words long. He is very easy going and a very easy grader. Late essay? He only docks 1 letter grade and you have the whole semester to still turn it in. He really loves what he is teaching and makes a boring class interesting! Easy A

His class was easy but there were not many assignments. Every assignment was an essay that was graded on. If you actually want to learn something you will have to be proactive and show up to classes and read the textbook otherwise you will not learn anything from this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Always gives a review before a test, which helps a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Does give 5 tests, but will drop the lowest
He gives great reviews before the test. Read the book and make sure you go to the review before the test and you'll make an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Final grade is based on 4 tests, but he always gives extra credit on the exams, which helps. Lots of lectures/Power Point.
Gives four exams during the semester. As long as you read the textbook and take good notes you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: he's a very nice old man, His lectures aren't boring and he loves to answer any questions you might have. The textbook he suggests is super cheap on amazon but you don't really need it. His lectures are pretty detailed but you have time to write everything down. The ONLY THING IS his test are all free response questions and then an essay!!

I really like Vejnar as a person but as a teacher he's horrible. he speaks in a monotone voice and reads straight off powerpoint. he helps you out in no way for tests. no study guide or anything. final grade consists of 4 tests averaged out in which the first 2 are 20% each third is 25% and the fourth (final) is 35%. his tests are Hard.

Only has 5 tests throughout the class and they are difficult if you don't study. includes 2-3 essay options for 60 points and short answer question worth 40. There is only another test instead of the final. He doesn't take attendance but you should go to class because some of the material he teaches isn't in the book.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Tests are somewhat of a pain. Written and non-multiple choice so you have to know your stuff. Overall he's very nice and even though others find him boring I think he's entertaining. Really loves what he teaches but knows we get bored so he sometimes puts on movies. Some things on the test he does not cover in class but are in the book.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY
